workflow_rationale: Adding complete Home Assistant Add-on support with s6-overlay service management, ingress UI, supervisor API integration, and proper HA add-on structure. This is a multi-component feature requiring Docker updates, service scripts, and documentation.

phases.name: S6-Overlay Integration
phases.description: Update Dockerfile to use s6-overlay for proper Home Assistant Add-on service management

subtasks.notes: Successfully added s6-overlay v3.1.5.0 installation to Dockerfile. Added ARG for version, downloaded and extracted both noarch and x86_64 archives, added bash and bashio dependencies, included rootfs/ copy for service scripts, and changed CMD to ENTRYPOINT ["/init"] to use s6-overlay init system. Verification passed.

phases.name: S6 Service Structure
phases.description: Create s6-overlay service directory structure and scripts for service management

subtasks.notes: Created container init script at rootfs/etc/cont-init.d/01-init.sh with bashio logging, directory setup, permission handling, prerequisite validation, and MQTT service checking. Script follows patterns from run.sh and is executable. Verification passed.

Created s6 service run script at rootfs/etc/services.d/smart-motion/run. The script uses the standard Home Assistant add-on pattern with #!/usr/bin/with-contenv bashio shebang and executes the main run.sh script. File is executable and verification passes.

Created s6 service finish script at rootfs/etc/services.d/smart-motion/finish. The script handles graceful shutdown by logging exit codes and signals received from s6-overlay. It uses bashio logging for Home Assistant integration and includes cleanup steps. Script follows the same pattern and style as other s6-overlay scripts (run and init). File is executable and verification passes.

phases.name: Configuration Updates
phases.description: Update config.yaml with final HA add-on metadata and verify schema

subtasks.notes: Config.yaml verified and validated successfully. All required HA add-on fields are present: name, version, slug, arch, startup, boot, init, options with defaults, comprehensive schema validation for all options, ingress configuration, ports, and MQTT service enabled. YAML validation passed. No changes needed - file was already in final state.

phases.name: Add-on Documentation
phases.description: Create comprehensive DOCS.md for Home Assistant Add-on store and user guidance

subtasks.description: Create DOCS.md with installation and configuration guide

verification.command: test -f DOCS.md && grep -q 'Installation' DOCS.md && grep -q 'Configuration' DOCS.md && echo 'OK'

subtasks.notes: Created comprehensive DOCS.md with installation guide, detailed configuration options for all settings (camera, motion, YOLO, OpenAI, MQTT, Telegram), usage examples, troubleshooting section, and performance tuning recommendations. Includes complete examples and Home Assistant integration patterns.

Successfully updated CHANGELOG.md with version 1.0.1 documenting the complete Home Assistant Add-on integration. Added comprehensive changelog entries covering s6-overlay integration, service management scripts, DOCS.md documentation, ingress support, MQTT auto-discovery, options UI schema, and Dockerfile updates. Verification passed - 'Home Assistant' appears in CHANGELOG.md. Committed changes successfully.

phases.name: Visual Assets
phases.description: Create or document requirements for add-on icon and logo

subtasks.description: Create placeholder/documentation for icon.png and logo.png

verification.instructions: Verify ASSETS.md documents icon.png (128x128) and logo.png (256x256) requirements

subtasks.notes: Successfully created comprehensive ASSETS.md documentation file. The file documents all requirements for icon.png (128x128) and logo.png (256x256), including design guidelines, color palette suggestions, creation tools (professional, free, AI-assisted), validation commands, and Home Assistant usage information. Includes quick start templates using ImageMagick, resources for design inspiration, and testing procedures. Manual verification confirmed - ASSETS.md properly documents both icon.png (128x128) and logo.png (256x256) requirements as specified. Committed successfully.

phases.name: Integration Testing
phases.description: Verify complete Home Assistant Add-on integration

subtasks.description: Verify all add-on files are in place

verification.command: test -f config.yaml && test -f Dockerfile && test -f DOCS.md && test -d rootfs/etc/services.d/smart-motion && test -d rootfs/etc/cont-init.d && echo 'OK'

subtasks.notes: All Home Assistant add-on files verified and in place: config.yaml (1650 bytes), Dockerfile (1219 bytes), DOCS.md (12925 bytes), rootfs/etc/services.d/smart-motion/ directory with run and finish scripts, rootfs/etc/cont-init.d/ directory with 01-init.sh. Verification command passed successfully.

verification.instructions: Review HA_INTEGRATION_CHECKLIST.md for manual verification steps

subtasks.notes: Document manual verification steps: build add-on, install in HA, test options UI, verify ingress, check MQTT, view logs

parallel_groups.reason: No dependencies, different file sets - can work in parallel

acceptance_criteria: All required add-on files present (config.yaml, Dockerfile, DOCS.md, rootfs/)
Service scripts are executable and use correct shebangs

verification_steps.name: File Structure Check
verification_steps.command: test -f config.yaml && test -f Dockerfile && test -f DOCS.md && test -d rootfs && echo 'OK'

verification_steps.name: Script Permissions
verification_steps.command: find rootfs -type f -name '*.sh' -o -name 'run' -o -name 'finish' | xargs -I {} test -x {} && echo 'OK'

verification_steps.name: Manual HA Installation Test
verification_steps.expected_outcome: Add-on builds, installs, and runs in HA

verification_strategy.reasoning: Medium risk - modifying Docker build and adding service management. Requires integration testing but no automated tests for HA-specific features. Manual verification in real HA environment recommended.

checks: Add-on starts and shows in logs
